meanings.definition: Not able to change or adjust to new conditions or situations.
meanings.sent1: The old machine was unadaptable to the new software.
meanings.sent2: She found the unadaptable puzzle too challenging to solve.
meanings.sent3: The unadaptable cat refused to use the new litter box.
meanings.sent4: His unadaptable mindset was like a rock in the river of progress.
meanings.sent5: The unadaptable tree stood firm against the changing winds of time.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being modified or altered to fit a different purpose.
meanings.sent1: The unadaptable material could not be reshaped into a different form.
meanings.sent2: The antique clock was unadaptable for modern technology integration.
meanings.sent3: The unadaptable shoe refused to be comfortable no matter how much she tried.
meanings.sent4: His unadaptable attitude was like a locked door, impossible to change.
meanings.sent5: The unadaptable design of the building made renovations nearly impossible.
